Manage Project closeout reports and handover of O&M manuals to the Data Center Operation Team.

Requirements:

At least 10 years of experience in a data center project manager in Mechanical and Electrical roles.
Experience with data center build-outs projects. Strong project management experience across disciplines and practices. Strong leadership and problem-solving skills. Provide recommendations on new data center equipment and facilities, including new designs, technologies, and construction methods.
Proficient Project Life Cycle Management and implementation. Strong communication skills in Mandarin and English, able to work with multiple engineering teams in a diverse environment

Description:
In KPMG’s Management Consulting practice, we don't limit ourselves to either strategy or implementation. Instead, we deliver both. As part of the Greater Bay Area our team in Hong Kong
 represents a dynamic and enthusiastic team that always pushes itself to succeed. Since our creation, we've developed in-depth knowledge of an incredibly broad spread of sectors and services.

KPMG’s Technology Risk team focus on the use of technology by our clients and help 1st , 2nd and 3rd line of defense in navigating the relevant technology risk and compliance matters in a
 strategic and tactical manner. Our professionals do this by leveraging our strong industry, IT control and technology focus and experience; deploying leading methodologies and tools; applying our objectivity; using a balanced approach to growth and risk; utilizing
 our comprehensive global breadth and local knowledge; and calling upon our deep understanding of relevant business, financial, and regulatory inter-dependencies.

KPMG is currently seeking both Senior Consultants and Consultants to join the team


Responsibilities

- Assist in planning activities, development of audit program, and execution of IT-related audits and risk assessments in the following areas: cybersecurity, IT strategy and governance, IT
 operations, business continuity and disaster recovery, network and infrastructure security, cloud and third party risk, programs and projects, automation, GITCs and application controls, and regulatory/compliance requirements
- Review clients' processes and controls against leading practice and industry frameworks, identify gaps in design and execution, and communicate issues and recommendations to engagement leads
 and client management
- Work with client management team to assist in implementation of new processes and controls to address key risks, as necessary
- Draft comprehensive executive summaries and final reports for delivery to client senior management and document and review engagement workpapers in accordance with standard KPMG and industry-accepted
 methodologies
- Assist in kickoff, status, and closing meetings with engagement team and client and contribute to technology risk knowledge base and internal practice development initiatives

Additional Responsibilities For Senior Consultant

- Plan and execute IT-related audit engagements and risk assessments with a focus on strategic, operational and regulatory/compliance related risks
- Lead kickoff, status, and closing meetings with engagement team and client and contribute to technology risk knowledge base and internal practice development initiatives
- Supervise consultants on engagements

Qualifications

- Minimum of one year of experience working within an internal audit, IT risk or IT compliance function as an internal employee or as part of a professional services firm
- Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university or equivalent work experience; CISA, PMP, CISSP or CRISC certification is preferred
- Familiarity leading and executing risk-based IT-related internal audits and/or risk and control assessments, leveraging IT governance and control frameworks such as COBIT, NIST CSF, NIST
 800-53, and ITIL
- Experience in implementation of internal control processes and programs for IT
- Proficiency in executing projects in accordance with leading practice project management principles
- Strong leadership and communication skills, technical knowledge, and the ability to write at a publication quality level in order to communicate findings and recommendations to the clients
 and senior management team

Additional Qualifications For Senior Consultant

- Minimum of three years of experience working within an internal audit, IT risk or IT compliance function as an internal employee or as part of a professional services firm
- Experience leading and executing risk-based IT-related internal audits and/or risk and control assessments, leveraging IT governance and control frameworks such as COBIT, NIST CSF, NIST
 800-53, and ITIL

We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment.

Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.

 All rights reserved.

Description:
In KPMG's Advisory practice, we don't limit ourselves to either strategy or implementation. Instead, we deliver both. Our team in Hong Kong and in China is a young and enthusiastic team
 that always pushes itself to succeed. Since our creation, we've developed in-depth knowledge of an incredibly broad spread of sectors and services.

Advisory is a core service area for KPMG China and we are looking for high caliber graduates with up to 2 years’ experience to join our Financial Risk Management practice.

KPMG’s Financial Risk Management (FRM) advisory team advises financial services clients on the development and implementation of risk management strategies, policies, systems, solutions, and
 controls. Working with professionals from KPMG’s international and local network we offer a broad range of financial risk management services to help local and international banks, insurance companies, asset managers, and corporate and public clients identify,
 assess, manage, report, and limit the risks they face.

Our scope of work covers the full spectrum of financial risks, such as credit risk, market risk, operational risk and liquidity risk; economic capital, capital management, stress testing,
 risk modeling and validation; regulatory compliance issues; licensing and regulatory reporting. There is a particular emphasis currently on the local and international regulatory and risk management initiatives, such as Initial Margin, FRTB, and pricing model
 validation (including but not limited to digital, barrier, Vanna Volga, HW1F, Local Vol, LMM, Heston), etc. Clients include both local and global financial services institutions, and especially there is a strong focus on Chinese financial institutions in Hong
 Kong.

We currently have outstanding opportunities in Hong Kong for candidates with up to 2 years post-graduation experience to join our expanding FRM team as we further develop our leading market
 position in the provision of financial services advisory.

Responsibilities

- Work on project teams to provide high quality, professional day-to-day execution of FRM engagements to financial institutions, in particular
- Planning, implementation, and process optimisation of enterprise risk management for financial institutions
- Valuation, modelling and quantitative management of financial instruments
- Market risk management consulting
- Credit risk management consulting
- Operational risk management consulting
- Liquidity risk management consulting
- Treasury management
- Other SFC and HKMA regulatory compliance consulting
- Support engagement planning, scheduling, coordination and administration of engagements
- Develop and maintain productive working relationships with client personnel
- Assist with proposal drafting and business development activities
- Build strong internal relationships within the Advisory practice and across other services

Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Financial Mathematics, Financial Engineering, Financial Risk Management, Quantitative Economics, or other related field from an accredited college
 / university
- Strong written and verbal communication skills in English and Cantonese and/or Putonghua, including business and technical writing and presentation skills
- Strong planning and organizing skills, with the ability to work effectively under pressure managing projects/deliverables
- Self-motivated and able to work independently with the ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment. Highly adaptive and flexible
Desirable skills / experience
- Up to 2 years’ experience in compliance or risk management in either credit, liquidity, market risks or capital management, and preferably experience gained in multi-national corporations,
 public listed companies or professional services firm
- Experience with VBA, Python, C++, SQL, R, SAS, Matlab

We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment.

Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.


© 2020 KPMG, a Hong Kong partnership and a member firm of the KPMG network of independent member firms affiliated with KPMG International Cooperative ("KPMG International"), a Swiss entity.
 All rights reserved.

Description:
In KPMG's Advisory practice, we don't limit ourselves to either strategy or implementation. Instead, we deliver both. Our team in Hong Kong and in China is a young and enthusiastic team
 that always pushes itself to succeed. Since our creation, we've developed in-depth knowledge of an incredibly broad spread of sectors and services.


Banking Advisory is a core service area for KPMG China and we are looking for a Consultant to join our Financial Risk Management practice.


KPMG’s Financial Risk Management (FRM) Banking Advisory team advises clients on the development and implementation of risk management policies, systems, solutions, and controls. Working with
 professionals from KPMG’s international and local networks, we offer a broad range of financial risk management services to help international banks, insurance companies, asset managers, and corporate and public clients identify, assess, manage, report, and
 limit the risks they face. 

Our scope of work covers the full spectrum of financial risks, such as credit risk, market risk, operational risk and liquidity risk; economic capital, capital management, stress testing,
 risk modeling and validation and regulatory compliance issues. There is a particular emphasis currently on the local and international regulatory and risk management initiatives, such as Initial Margin, FRTB, and pricing model validation (including but not
 limited to digital, barrier, Vanna Volga, HW1F, Local Vol, LMM, Heston), etc. Clients include both local and global financial institutions, and especially there is a strong focus on Chinese financial institutions in Hong Kong.


We currently have an outstanding opportunity in Hong Kong for Senior Consultant to provide experience and to help our expanding FRM team further develop its leading market position in the
 provision of banking advisory services. Depending on experience and skills, the role will include the delivery and management of compliance and risk management projects, and staff management for ensuring the future growth of the Financial Services Advisory
 practice in Hong Kong & China. 

Responsibilities

- Support Engagement Managers to provide high quality, professional day-to-day execution of FRM projects to financial institutions, in particular
  - Planning, implementation, and process optimisation of enterprise risk management for financial institutions
  - Valuation, modelling and quantitative management of financial instruments
  - Market risk management consulting
  - Credit risk management consulting
  - Operational risk management consulting
  - Liquidity risk management consulting

  - Other SFC and HKMA regulatory compliance consulting

- Develop and maintain productive working relationships with client personnel, and lead client meetings
- Assist with proposal drafting and business development activities
- Build strong internal relationships within the Advisory practice and across other services

Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Financial Mathematics, Financial Engineering, Financial Risk Management, Quantitative Economics, or other related field from an accredited college
 / university
- Around 2 - 4 years’ experience in operating or regulatory compliance, risk management in either credit, liquidity, market or operational risks or capital management, and preferably experience
 gained in multi-national corporations, public listed companies or professional services firms
- Experience with VBA, Python, C++, SQL, R, SAS, Matlab is a plus
- Qualified HKICPA, ACCA, AICPA, CIA, FRM, CFA or equivalent would be advantageous
- Strong written and verbal communication skills in English and Cantonese, fluency in Putonghua would be advantageous
- Strong interpersonal, influencing and communication skills
- Self-motivated and able to work independently
- Demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment. Highly adaptive and flexible

Description:
Make a Difference in Your Professional Career!
To support RGP's continuous growth, our Hong Kong practice welcomes seasoned IFRS 9 professionals who are innovative, result-driven,
 people-oriented and passionate in business consulting to join.

Our Consultants enjoy the flexibility and autonomy to choose the client projects that interest them, while continuing to build professional relationships within our global community
 of Consultant and business professionals.

Key Responsibilities of the Role

Take up an investment accounting SME role to identify, analyze and assess the impacts/dependencies and design
 possible solutions for supporting client’s IFRS 9 financial reporting process
Work with stakeholders, workstreams, such as investment, accounting and actuarial, and solution team for the IFRS 9 implementation, particularly in the investment-related accounting and
 regulatory reporting areas Monitor the UAT process and review the test results to ensure they are accurate and in compliance with the IFRS 9 requirements
Work with client’s external auditor to review the IFRS 9 framework, SPPI and ECL
Work collaboratively with the client to transition new IFRS 9 processes into the business as usual environment 

Requirements

Degree in Finance, Accounting or related disciplines
CPA and relevant professional qualification
Minimum 10 years of proven experience in an investment accounting role within a life assurance/financial services environment
Experience in revisiting the financial systems and processes within investment accounting and financial reporting, with possible impacts on asset-liability management and investment management
Good understanding of regulatory requirements, e.g. IAS 39 and/or IFRS 9
Knowledgeable in project management is an advantage
Ability to work through tight deadlines
Effective communication skills to articulate complex concepts in a concise manner to varying audiences
Immediately available highly preferred

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We offer competitive compensation & benefits to the appropriate candidate. Interested parties, please forward your resume by pressing the
APPLY button below. Data received will be for recruiting purposes only.

Description:
The opportunity
 
Do you like to create and innovate?

 
Cyber threats, emerging technologies, cloud adoption, digital disruption, and changing regulatory landscape are some
 of the challenges that customers face. EY teams are seeking people to join the fast growing EY businesses
in helping clients implement provable security at scale to combat these challenges. In particular, EY teams need people with proven experience and passion in penetration testing to help clients secure their application and infrastructure.
 If this is you, you will also have the opportunity to innovate on new ideas, technologies and explore new challenges.
Your key responsibilities

Lead the hands-on services of customer engagements. Solve real world problems; Simplify and innovate on behalf of customers; Translate your thoughts into action yielding measurable results
Be a deep technical resource that earns EY customers’ and colleagues’ trust as an experienced professional in cloud technologies and application & data modernization e.g. microservices
 architecture Develop high-quality technical content, such as automation tools, reference architectures, and points of views to help EY customers with their cloud journey
Generate ideas for new solutions or repeatable customer offerings that can be developed and taken to market
Support business development activities by developing solution leadership in cloud, data and applications
Coach and develop junior consultants to drive excellence in EY cloud practice

 
Skills and attributes for success

Strong interpersonal and communication skills; ability to work in a team environment
Ability to work independently with minimal direction; self-starter/self-motivated
Technical writing experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with at least 10 years’ related work experience in Architecture/Engineering, Application & data modernization using leading cloud technologies such as Amazon
 Web Services (AWS), Azure, VMware NSX, RedHat OpenShift and automation technologies such as Terraform and Ansible
Demonstrated understanding of what it means to draw out customer needs and deliver practical outcomes addressing those needs.
Experience automating IT & security tasks i.e. AIOps
Hands-on technical knowledge/experience in building and deploying Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Technical knowledge/experience (design and/or implementation) in Cloud Computing technologies
Strong understanding and experience in architecting secure cloud architectures (full stack)
Desirable experience in architectural implications of meeting industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST frameworks
Working knowledge of common and industry standard cloud-native/cloud-friendly authentication mechanisms (OAuth, OpenID, etc.)

What working at EY offers

Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you


  
If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
Join us in building a better working world.
 
Apply Now.
Summary: Bachelor’s degree,At least 10 years’ related work experience,Excellent written and spoken English

Description:
The Internal Audit and Risk Management Office using systematic, disciplined approach provides independent, objective assurance and consulting
 services to the management to ensure effectiveness of internal controls, risk management and governance processes.
Job Duties:

Audit Strategy


play a key role in team management and drive best practices and continuous improvement and initiatives for the internal audit function
participate in the development of the annual audit plan and audit methodology


Internal audit Jobs


plan, manage and execute internal audit jobs as per approved plan and other ad hoc assignment
monitor progress of multiple simultaneous projects and take necessary action to meet target completion dates
supervise staff members to adopt effective and efficient audit approach and clearly document the audit results
prepare report of audit finding to auditee with observation, root cause and implication of issue in sufficient details and make efficient and effective recommendation for corrective action


Risk management


provide assurance that effective risk management practice is implemented in the operations to minimize the impact of significant inherent risks on attainment of their objective
assess adequacy of internal control for operational risk in line with the mandate for corporate governance


Compliance training


implant a professional and ethical culture to HKPC staff members by conduct regular trainings on policy and procedures, ethical standard etc.


Job Requirements:


Bachelor Degree from an accredited college/university in an appropriate field
A qualified accountant of a recognized professional accounting body and Certified Internal Auditor qualifications an advantage
Minimum of 12 years’ solid audit experience preferably gained from a big 4 accounting firm and /or sizeable organisations in the public or commercial sector
Strong experience in planning, conducting, reviewing and reporting on operational audits
Experience in IT auditing and the use of CAATs will be an added advantage
Strong presentation and report writing skills with an excellent command of verbal and written English and Chinese (Mandarin would be an advantage)
Assertive, meticulous with strong analytical, interpersonal, communication and influencing skills
Self-motivated, highly committed and able to work independently
Highly adaptive and flexible and with ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment
Applicants may be considered for other positions if not matching the requirements of the subject position


Applications:
HKPC will take into consideration both the quantitative and qualitative requirements of the post when selecting the suitable candidates. A
 competitive salary package commensurate with academic qualifications and experience will be offered. 
Applicants should send application, together with a detailed resume, current and expected salary and contact telephone number by clicking
 "Apply Now" (quoting the reference number on the subject heading) on or before
23 September 2020.
Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only.  Candidates not invited for interviews within 6 weeks may consider their
 applications unsuccessful and the applications will be disposed by HKPC within 12 months.

Description:
Join us to create new values to the online offline commerce communities
Price.com.hk, being one of the most popular online platforms* in Hong Kong, strives to bring extra values to merchants and consumers by not only connecting them seamlessly with our
 state-of-the-art technology but co-creating a community that encourages a more user centric shopping experience combined with the application of big data analytics.
We start with a goal to minimize market information costs incurred upon consumers allowing them to find their favorite products easier and faster and at the same time enable merchants
 to successfully run their brick and click strategies to reach their targeted consumers at the lowest cost possible. Today, we are serving 2M+ monthly unique visitors. We cannot accomplish that without working together with individuals who are passionate about
 what they do.
*According to Alexa, Price.com.hk is one of the top 25 most frequently visited sites in Hong Kong.
https://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/price.com.hk
Your role with us involves:

System and software design, defining the technical standards/specifications and coding styles, problem-solving, writing documentation
Web applications/services/system/automation tools (frontend, and/or backend) development and maintenance
Assisting team lead to supervise the micro-scale team(s) to deliver the work in high quality
Code review and technical consultation
Taking the challenges to conduct the R&D / POC / Prototyping on new technologies
Collaborating with UX/UI, QA, and Product Management teams to deliver best-in-class e-commerce experience on both web and mobile platforms

As an employer, our role is to empower you by bringing your true talents and best self to this dynamic digital world and people we serve. We welcome individuals from all
 backgrounds, ideally with skills and traits as below:

6 years or above relevant working experience
Degree or above in computer science or other related disciplines
Solid experience in web and e-commerce development (SDLC/methodologies, technologies), programming skills (shall include but not limited to PHP, JS, and Typescript), software
 and system design, OOP and design patterns, and Linux administration/operation
Experience in MySQL, ELK, Git, Docker, or cloud platform is preferred
Familiar with Jira, DevOps, NoSQL, or cybersecurity would be an advantage
Tech-savvy and willing to share new technical knowledge
Great team player, independent, a strong sense of responsibility and self-motivated
Good communication skills, fluent written and spoken Cantonese and English

Be part of us, you will enjoy:

Discretionary Bonus
5-day Work Week
Flexible Working Hour
Birthday, Marriage, Maternity and Paternity Leave
Birthday Gift
Medical Insurance
Monthly Birthday Party
Team Event and Team Building Activities
Happy and Dynamic Environment
Casual Dress Code

Working Location: Kwun Tong (5 minutes from Kwun Tong MTR station)


Interested parties, please click "Apply now" to submit your portfolio and resume with the
availability and expected salary to us.


Personal data collected will be kept strictly confidential and only be used for recruitment related purposes.

Description:
About the role
Equipment and Automation Technology (E&A), Nexperia’s in-house equipment & solution provider, develops, supplies and services world’s fastest pick & place equipment and testers for (discrete)
 semiconductors. Our equipment and solutions play an important role in the roadmap towards cost leadership in Nexperia’s assembly and test sites in Asia
What you will do

Work in product team Die Bond
Responsible for software development of functions or features to improve or speed-up existing equipment with limited investments
Work closely with the customer, translate customer requirements into design specification, study the feasibility, design the software including simulators, GUI and test procedures
Test and document the designed solutions and related results
Introduce & release the solutions in assembly sites according to plan and follow through to full completion and acceptance
Conduct failure analysis and recommend corrective actions for customer complaints/incidents
Work closely with the cross-functional team in delivering design solutions and solving problems

What you will need

University graduate MSc/BSc in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
Minimum 5 years design experience on embedded or technical software engineering
Experience with visual inspections is a pre
Experience with semi conductor equipment is a pre
Possess any of the following skills: Product data management, Simulation tooling (MATLAB, Spice, etc), C, C++, ADA
Possess excellent technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Conduct failure analysis report (FAR) on customer claimed issues using six-sigma tools (DMAIC, 8D, PDCA, DFMEA and FTA)
Excellent communication skills with fluency in English, Cantonese and/or Mandarin is a pre.
Flexibility to travel overseas

About the team
When you join our company, you join our team. TeamNexperia, an 11,000+ strong international network that both supports and challenges you to grow. We listen to each other and work together
 with enthusiasm, energy and encouragement to get things done efficiently. Constantly pushing the boundaries, we collaborate with our customers, partners and local communities to meet ever-increasing expectations regardless of the challenges we face. Priding
 ourselves on going the extra mile to achieve world-class results. And valuing the passion, professionalism and perseverance each one of us brings, to make Nexperia the Efficiency Company.
Summary: Global semiconductor company,Regional team,Diverse working culture

Description:
YesStyle is looking for passionate talents, who love and appreciate the fascination of Asian fashion and beauty. Our team is active, energetic, and culturally diverse.

To embrace the idea of work-life balance, we also endeavor to create a fun and enjoyable environment for our team members.
You will work as part of the growing Promotion & Retention Team.  You will provide actionable insights by analyzing data to reflect trends on our customers, competitors and company performances in the area of Sales,  Promotion and Campaigns. You will help
 to plan, forecast and analyse promotional strategies. You will prepare both regular and ad-hoc reports to gain insights and help the team to further develop the promotion strategy.
What You'll Do:  

You are responsible for building, managing, improving and automating both promotion & retention team’s regular reports, ensure high accuracy and on-time delivery.
You help to draw actionable insights from the regular and ad-hoc reports to advise on promotion and specific campaign strategies.
Working with promotion area owners and global campaign owners to forecast the performance and  ROI of promotions being planned, and evaluate promotions after completion.
You help to monitor competitors promotion activities. You create and manage a competitor promotion tracking tool to provide insights for promotion area owners for better promotion planning.
You help to provide qualitative customer insights to aid decision makings by building and managing regular reports that help the company to understand customers’ intentions.
Responsible to create and maintain a repository of historical promotions financial performance, trends and associated tactics for future planning purposes.
Overseeing promotion activities for other YesAsia subsidiaries. Conduct ad-hoc customer segment and cohort analysis. Collaborate with various teams to support them with additional insights. Help in various projects with a focus on data quality and reports. 
What You Have:  

3-5 years of experience in a similar role Proficient in MS Excel and Tableau Experience in promotion planning, forecasting and analysing Experience in creating and managing performance reports and customer behaviour reports
Experience in communicating and working across multiple departments Knowledge of Google Analytics, Data Studio or Adobe Analytics is an advantage
Must be a team player with a very strong analytical mindset and sensitive to numbers
Must be detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills Possesses a bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Marketing, Computer Science or similar

Company: The Hong Kong And China Gas Co Ltd
Description:
The Role:

Report directly to the General Manager – Corporate Audit & Risk Management, and lead a seven-person team (including managers and senior consultants) in Group Risk Management function to
 provide centralised overall coordination of the risk management processes in HK and China
Be responsible for the Enterprise Risk Management system (“ERM”) of the whole Group, which includes formulating risk management strategies adhering to the latest
 regulatory requirement and company objectives,  innovating risk management techniques to improve existing procedure, integrating live incident reporting, group risk registers, operational and project risks, and human resources
Liaise with different stakeholders of group business units (regardless of geographical location) on risk assessment, identification and mitigation as well as
 regular update of the risk dashboards Assure proper implementation of all risk management policies and guidelines
Responsible for risk-based audit and risk reviews
Develop and prepare regular reports of significant risks and other documents to senior management and Board Audit & Risk Committee
Provide advice to all group units on the company’s new initiatives and existing operations from a risk and control perspective
Monitor and evaluate risks as well as act as an gatekeeper in merger & acquisition projects
Provide training and technical advice to management and employees regarding risk management strategies and programs
Handle ad-hoc tasks of department

The Person:

University degree preferably in risk management, finance, accounting or related discipline, with professional qualification (e,g, CPA, CIA, CISA, CRMA or CFE etc.) is a plus
Minimum 15 years of risk management and relevant experience preferably gained from sizable corporations with at least 10 years’ experience at managerial level
Knowledge of risk management frameworks and relevant local/ global regulatory requirements, and knowledge of fraud is an added advantage
Strong analytical, interpersonal, communication, problem solving and presentation skills
Strong command of written and spoken English and Chinese, fluency in Putonghua is required
PRC experience is preferred and occasional travel to PRC is required

Application with full details stating current and expected salary to: APPLY NOW 
Please quote the reference number (CARMD/AGMRM/JDB01/20) in your application.
(All personal data provided will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purposes only.)
Summary: Be responsible for the Enterprise Risk Management,Responsible for risk-based audit and risk reviews,Minimum 15 years of risk management/relevant exp.

Description:
Job purpose



The job holder is responsible for assisting the team in the overall impairment assessment, credit RWA analysis, ICAAP and stress testing for the Bank and
 its overseas branches and subsidiaries.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in performing impairment assessment and analysis, credit RWA analysis, ICAAP, stress
 testing and CVA/DVA.

Coordinate inputs from various stakeholders within the Bank and compile
management reports and disclosures for analysis and internal monitoring.
Assist in review, enhance and implement internal credit models, credit risk stress-testing models, impairment provision models
 and, risk based pricing models. Assist in formulate policies and procedures to facilitate credit risk management related processes.
Engage in projects for new regulatory requirements and business initiatives.
Provide specification of user requirements and prototyping and perform User Acceptance Test in the development of new risk management infrastructure.
Provide analytics support to business initiatives and Risk Appetite.


Requirements



Degree holder in Risk Management, Mathematics, Statistics or related discipline.
3 years’ hands-on experience in statistics and analytics or related banking experience.
Sound knowledge of Basel requirement, credit risk rating modeling and scorecards preferred.
Proficient in SAS, Excel, Access and VBA programming.
Highly analytical and detail-oriented.
Proficient in written and spoken English and Chinese (including Putonghua).
Candidate with more relevant experiences can be considered as Assistant Manager.

For more details about career opportunities with the Bank, please visit our website
http://www.cncbinternational.com/careers/en/index.jsp.
 Please apply with full resume stating current and expected salaries.

China CITIC Bank International is committed to being an equal opportunities employer and intends to provide a work environment free of unlawful discrimination
 or harassment. All employment decisions will be made in a non-discriminatory manner.

Description:
This is a fixed-term contract position of minimum 2 years with possibility for renewal subject to organizational needs and individual performance.
This incumbent is responsible for providing support to the Senior Project Architect in architectural design works.  This involves ensuring that the works are designed,
 specified and built to achieve the required level of service; to specified standards of materials and workmanship; and that they are completed safely, on time and within budget to the satisfaction of the Authority.

Responsibilities:

Providing technical assistance to ensure architectural elements are designed, specified and built to achieve
 the required standards of aesthetics, materials, coordination and workmanship;
Reviewing consultants’ designs and contractors’ submissions to ensure compliance with sound architectural principles and the required standards;
Reviewing technical proposals and site works to ensure that the required quality and safety standards are maintained;
Analyzing technical submissions for compliance with the specified requirements;
Monitoring progress of the works, maintaining comprehensive records and preparing thorough progress reports;
Co-coordinating design and construction interface issues and proactively resolve potential clashes and;
Preparing design proposals as required to facilitate the project works.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Architecture or related disciplines with at least 6 years’ relevant experience, of which a minimum of 3 years should be in project management
Member of HKIA or other equivalent professional bodies
Experience in 
management of airport terminal design and construction works is preferred
Good command of spoken and written English and Chinese
Proficient in MS Office applications and project management software tools
Knowledge of CADD software such as AutoCAD and BIM is an advantage

Interested parties please apply online via https://www.hongkongairport.com/en/careers/


Closing date: 22 September 2020
Data collected will only be used for job application processing. Applicant not being contacted by the Authority within eight weeks from the application closing date may assume that his/her application is unsuccessful.
 All personal data will be kept for a period of 12 months from the application closing date and will be destroyed afterwards.
Summary: Degree in Architecture,At least 6 years’ relevant experience,3 years in project management

Description:
Note: Please only submit one application, even if you are interested in more than
 one opportunity. A recruiter will speak to you about all options available after we review your application. 
At FDM it’s ‘business as usual’, we are recruiting now and throughout the year. Due to COVID-19 we have implemented alternative working arrangements to ensure
 that all our people stay safe. These consist of remote working, virtual training, video interviewing, and access to webinars and virtual events. We have training start dates throughout the year. If you’re looking to start your career in technology or business,
 we want to hear from you now!
Launch your career in the world’s fastest growing industry.
Do you thrive in fast-paced technical environments and have a strong attention to detail? Are you eager to have a career where you are encouraged to meet your
 potential and have the opportunity to work for a prestigious company with an impressive global presence?
FDM is currently seeking a number of ambitious and driven candidates with the aptitude for IT to work as FDM consultants with our top clients, many of which are
 leading companies in the banking and financial services industry.
FDM creates and inspires exciting careers that shape our digital future. Through our Careers Programme, we recruit and train those aspiring to become IT and business
 professionals before deploying them on to client sites worldwide. With centres across APAC, Europe and North America, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer.
We are currently seeking candidates interested in building a career in Technical Business Analysis.
Business Analyst (Technical) roles often involve access to business areas in
 major financial institutions, working on sensitive information and high profile projects, and gaining first-hand exposure to the trade lifecycle. The role is crucial in helping organisations with the accuracy and timely presentation of data, in line with internal
 process, governance, and regulatory requirements. These opportunities are perfect for those who are team players with strong analytical skills and an aptitude for fast learning.
The training will take place virtually with the FDM Hong Kong Academy. Once you have completed training, you will work with one or more of our clients in Hong
 Kong for a minimum of two years. After the two years, you can remain with FDM or you may have the opportunity to transition to an in house role at FDM or to carry on working with the client as a member of their permanent team.
There is no better way to launch your career than with FDM!
What we offer you: 

Industry recognised training and qualifications
Key skills development e.g. stakeholder management, communication, planning and Microsoft Excel
A minimum of two years commercial experience working with some of the world’s most reputable organisations
Mentoring and on-going support throughout your career with FDM

What we are looking for:


Eligible to work in Hong Kong
Bachelor’s degrees (preferably in Finance, Business, Management, or a STEM related field)
Excellent communication in English and an ability to build relationships
Ability to engage yourself in a project and enjoy the challenges and processes involved
An analytical approach and problem solving abilities
Proven ability to work under pressure and in fast-paced environments
Excellent attention to detail and strong organisational and time management abilities
Able to commit to the two-year consultant programme with FDM following completion of training
A strong interest in working in technology and/or financial environments
Previous experience with Excel VBA, SQL or Unix
A problem solver with a keen eye for detail
Able to engage yourself in a project and enjoy the challenges and processes involved
Flexible, eager, ambitious and adaptable to change
Be able to commit to a two-year contract with FDM upon completion of the training period

Desirable but not required:


Fluency in Cantonese or Mandarin


With the world at your fingertips, all you have to do is click apply.
Application Close Date: 24th August 2020
To find out more about our graduate opportunities, please visit https://www.fdmgroup.com/en-hk/hk-home/
Summary: Industry Recognised Training and Qualifications,Up to 16 days Annual Leave,Competitive Salary

Description:
Our client is an institute working closely with government, local regulatory bodies, industry practitioners and their members to set, raise and
 promote professional standards for the financial services industry. 
The role will broadly split between providing support and enhancement services for existing systems and project-based work leading to the development and deployment of new business systems.
Responsibilities:-

Provide high quality application support to business, fulfilling requests accurately and in a timely manner.
Diagnose and resolve application incidents and problems in a range of applications such as content management system, online enrollment system, etc.
Monitor high priority incidents and problems, conduct root cause analysis and deliver resolution to avoid recurrence.
Assist in developing system support processes and ensure up-to-date documentation is available for cross team knowledge sharing.
Systems management and monitoring of server tasks to ensure incoming and outgoing data is processed reliably on schedule.
Exercise Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) best practices.
Responsible for application development and support with different workforce model. Coordinate with external vendors throughout the software development lifecycle.
Conduct Unit Test (UT), System Integration Testing (SIT), and coordinate User Acceptance Test (UAT), as required.
Coordinate system training to end-users and system support team as required.
Document project artifacts and deliverables, e.g. technical specifications, test cases, and test results.
Ensure consistent and high quality delivery against internal governance and best practice standards of software development and support.
Perform user requirement collection and system analysis with business analysts.  Ensure the system design reflects user requirements.
Explore latest technologies and evaluate capabilities of new products where necessary. Liaises with service providers to select the products or services that best meet company goals.

Requirements:-

Degree in computer science or related discipline.
ITIL Foundation Certification preferred.
Minimum 4 years of experience in the IT field, with at least 2 years of application support experience in cross-functional environment.
Experience in end-to-end system development lifecycle (SDLC) including requirements analysis, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
Hands-on experience on application systems management including but application solution design, application server management and programming.
Experience in collaborating with external development team and vendors for project delivery.
Ability to communicate ideas and solutions clearly and concisely in both verbal and written dialogue, for technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with good command of written and spoken English and Chinese.
Summary: Application support & new project development,Min 4 yrs application system management experience,Strong communication and interpersonal skills

Description:
As Salesforce's #1 global strategic partner, Accenture is empowering world-leading clients to design future-ready CRM solutions. Of the 12 vendors evaluated, we
 received the highest scores in being the leader of ‘Salesforce Implementation Partners’ recognized by the Forrester’s latest report.
Joining Accenture’s SFDC Project Team, you will be one of the functional leads whose work with and guide our clients to plan and create the digital roadmap introducing
 the latest technologies, and to build application that transcend today’s digital world and fundamentally enable change for our clients businesses.
For more information our SFDC updates, visit
https://www.accenture.com/hk-en/services/accenture-salesforce-index
 to discover more.
Your Responsibilities:

Be the expert to construct total solutioning proposal includes USP (Unique Selling Point) of offering and pricing, high level scope of both functional and technical requirements,
 data and security blueprint, resources planning and timeline during pre-sales stage by closely cooperating with sales lead and senior stakeholders
Design and deliver complex cross-domain solutions encompassing a rich variety of technologies and using a mixture of agile and planned methods to provide innovative solutions to
 address clients’ needs Work with internal and external stakeholders, client executives, partners, external vendors, and project members to manage and deliver successful solutions during implementation
 stage Participate in or to drive deep architectural discussions to build trust and rapport with clients during implementation stage
Proactive to keep abreast of new technologies and to promote the adoption of new initiatives on client side or internally
Be a trusted technical advisor to clients and project members to solve complex technical challenges, and
establish credibility & build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within internal and client organization

Qualifications

Degree holder preferably in Computer Science or Engineering disciplines
Minimum 8 years of professional experience in designing and implementing large scale distributed applications (i.e. several thousand man-days), preferably from consulting background
 with experience in establishing new practice Proven successful track record to design application(s) with extensive knowledge in SFDC or CRM solutions with integrations to related systems
Solid experience working with clients across cloud transformation projects with focus on at least 2 of the Salesforce.com major platforms (Sales Cloud / Service Cloud / Marketing
 Cloud / Commerce Cloud) Experience with common integration patterns used between legacy systems to integrate with Salesforce platform
Proven experience with APEX, Visualforce pages, API programming, Javascript, and writing SOQL queries. 
Experience in holistic SFDC solutions with a customer 360-degree view, and personalized service & marketing would be advantageous
Systems design experience, with the ability to architect or explain complex systems interactions including data flows, common interfaces, APIs and other methods
Broad system design and architecture skills with the ability to architect or explain complex systems interactions including data flows, common interfaces, APIs and infrastructure
Demonstrated ability to adapt and learn new technologies, and be passionate in updated trend
Excellent leadership, stakeholder management and communication skills to speak and present in front of senior executives (leadership is of lower priority)
Excellent command in both Cantonese, English and Mandarin (minimum to master 2 languages well to communicate professionally)
Hands on experience and knowledge in Microservices, Event Driven or Cloud Native; and container technologies (e.g. Kubernetes, Docker), services, and API models (e.g. Swagger, OpenAPI);
 and different storage solutions (e.g. SQL database(s), NoSQL such as MongoDB, Hadoop, Redis, etc.); and scalable networking technologies (e.g. Load Balancers, Firewalls) and web standards (e.g. REST APIs, web security mechanisms) is a plus
Certification in Salesforce.com and TOGAF is a plus
Summary: Salesforce / CRM practice,Solutioning and cost planning ,Pre-sales and PM role

Description:
You will:
• Collaborate with technology teams in defining the technology strategy, solutions and architecture in data.
• Establish and maintain core data models, information standard and data management lifecycle controls.
• Work closely with business sponsors to identify opportunities, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns.
• Take ownership of analytical projects end to end from extracting and exploring data, generating hypothesis, building structured analysis, and evaluating results.
• Apply industry best practice to create scalable data platform that supports big data development, deployment, operation, and management.
• Establish and execute the mechanism of data governance. Develop data standard and specifications, and monitor the implementation of data standard and specifications during the implementation of relevant projects.
• Develop data quality standards and data quality control plans, conduct data quality management, tracking and monitoring, and establish data quality evaluation systems.
• Lead in delivering the architectural design of enterprise scales, end-to-end solution for major projects; guide projects in their technology and vendor selections.
• Ensure business alignment by translating business strategy and direction into technical vision, strategy and roadmap.
• Lead in walk-throughs and reviews of systems design.
• Lead the resolution of technically complex, cross-system or long term issues that impact business operation.
• Lead the development of the IT architecture and facilitate its adoption; review technology selection and system designs for compliance with established architecture.
• Provide high level consultancy or advice to management and technical teams to assist in decision-making.
• Monitor and track progress of work products to ensure deliver according to predetermined estimates and plans
You should have:
• An university degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related disciplines
• Have 10 plus years of experience in technology with at least 5 years of architectural responsibilities (application or technical architecture)
• Have current and strong development skills enabling the ability to bring architecture definition to actual implementation
• Have excellent knowledge and experience of SCRUM
• Have leadership skills - be able to lead discussions as well as strong delivery focus
• Have good stakeholder management, influencing, and communication skills at all levels in the organization
• The candidate is expected to have experience in the architecting of large scale data lake system. Ideally the candidate will have experience with the following platforms, tools and processes:
- Data Science Languages / tools: R, Python, Tensorflow, Keras
- Visual Analytic Tools: SAS, Tableau, PowerBI, Metabase
- ETL Tools : IBM Datastage, Informatica, Talend
- Data Warehouse technology: Oracle Exadata, SQL Server, Teradata, Redshift, IBM Data Warehouse
- Database technology : Mysql, Postgresql, Mongodb, Oracle DB, IBM DB2, Microsoft SQL Server
- New Data Lake technology: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Hive, MapReduce, Data Lake Analytics, Athena
- Messaging technology: IBM MQ, Tibco, RabbitMQ
- Integration Platform : Mulesoft, Snaplogic
- Cloud Technology : Aliyun, AWS
- Container Technology : Kubernetes, Docker, Swarm
- Serverless Technology : Alibaba Function Compute, AWS Lambda, Kubeless
• The custom software is being built using iterative development processes leveraging DevOps principles at scale to achieve Continuous Integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD). The DevOps tools being used
 for deployment include Bit Bucket; Jenkins; Urban Code; Jira and associated add-ons and tools
• A proactive and can-do attitude. Excellent communication skills in English, Cantonese, and Mandarin.
• Candidates with more experience will be considered as Chief Systems Architect
We offer competitive remuneration packages and advancement opportunities:
Compensation

5-day work Annual Leave 18 or above Quarterly Bonus Quarterly Salary Review Half Year Promotion Review Competitive Medical and Dental Plan Training and Development Good Working Environment 
Birthday, Marriage, Maternity, Paternity and Compassionate Leave

Description:
Department: Digital
Report to: Analytics Manager
This role will enhance analytics capabilities through exploiting new data and advanced modeling, supported by proper design consideration, testing and training with business units, IMT
 and vendors. He/she will need to generate actionable quantitative insight to support the data & insight driven culture in decision making processes along with proactively support business streams on adopting appropriate metrics, analytics models and visualisation
 tools into day-to-day processes. He/she will also ensure quality & data governance policies and processes to uphold security, quality and value of the analytics assets.
Key responsibilities

Assist business streams users to frame business questions and articulate opportunities in order to define effective business requirements to meet objectives
Proactively evaluate and incorporate data & insights from new sources, to enhance capabilities of  analytics models
Coordinate with IMT and BU on UAT testing, including specifications review, testing approach design, UAT scoping and execution.
Ensure actionable insights are interfaced to targeted downline systems to support analytics usages and targeted actions
Design and build BI solutions and visualisation dashboards to inform business decisions and facilitate adoption of insights among user communities
Train and facilitate users to exploit insights to facilitate day-to-day decision making
Propose and follow through on benefit measurements and continuous improvement
Manage migration of queries and reports to support tools rationalisation project
Manage Data Quality by implementing quality metrics & regular monitoring, and working on incidents to ensure readiness, accessibility and consistency of analytics capabilities
Enforce data governance practices to uphold the value of the data access, both within the company and with external parties

Requirements

Tertiary education in Actuarial Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Management, Operations Research or related disciplines;
Minimum 3 years of working experience relating to data & analytics with a good understanding of at least one of the following business areas: Operations, Customer management, Service Delivery,
 Sales & Marketing or Finance Strong analytical abilities, numerate and familiar with statistical algorithms, ideally with exposure in developing optimization models
Expert in using analytics & query tools e.g. Alteryx, SQL, SAS, Python
Proficiency in data modelling techniques and visualisation tools e.g.Qlikview, Qliksense, Power BI
Team player with strong communication & interpersonal skills, able to share effectively across different business streams
Curious, meticulous, self-motivated and strong continuous improvement mindset
Working knowledge in managing vendors and suppliers and project management a plus

Application Deadline: 13 September 2020
Cathay Pacific is an Equal Opportunities Employer. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes
 only. Candidates not notified within eight weeks may consider their application unsuccessful. All related information will be kept in our file for up to 24 months. A copy of our Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request by contacting

Description:
Job Responsibilities

Review and implement the overall risk management process for company.
Organize and coordinate risk assessment, evaluation, control and risk report.
Facilitate the updates of risk appetite, risk management framework and risk register periodically.
Prepare risk management reports for submission to senior management, head office, the board…etc.
Perform research and keep abreast of the regulatory requirements and market practices on risk-related issues.
Drive company to comply with laws and regulations, and to comply with internal compliance guidelines and policies.
Organize and coordinate corporate compliance management and internal control, including revision system, compliance review, risk identification, compliance
 inspection, internal control evaluation, etc. To assist in reviewing relevant laws, regulations and regulations issued by regulatory agencies and developing appropriate compliance policies for the company.
Ensure that employees are up-to-date on the company's risk and compliance areas.
Provide legal compliance support for other day-to-day management of the company.
Perform other related duties as needed.

Job Requirements

Bachelor degree or above, majoring in Insurance,
Business Administration, Law, Risk Management or Finance /Accounting preferred.
Professional qualification in Risk Management or Legal will be advantage.
More than 5 years of managerial working experience in Financial or Regulatory companies with more than 3 years of experience in Risk Management, Compliance
 or Internal Control. Better hands-on experience in implementing Compliance and Risk Management frameworks.
Understanding of regulatory environment of financial sector in Hong Kong.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

工作職責

審查和實施公司的整體風險管理流程。
組織和協調風險監察、評估、控制和風險報告。
定期更新風險偏好、風險管理框架和風險登記冊。
按公司高級管理層、集團、董事會等要求制定風險管理報告。
根據監管機構的要求和市場實踐,密切監察及跟進風險相關事宜。
推動及確保公司遵守法律法規、內部合規準則和政策。
組織和協調公司合規管理和內部控制(包括:修訂系統、合規監察、風險識別、合規審查、內部控制評估等)。
根據監管機構發佈的相關法律、法規和法規制定及落實適當的合規政策。
確保員工瞭解公司的風險和合規領域的最新情況。
為公司的其他日常管理提供法律合規支援。
根據需要執行其他相關職責。

崗位要求

具有大學或以上學歷，主修保險、工商管理、法學、風險管理或財務/會計更佳。
具有風險管理或法律相關專業資格者更佳。
具有5年以上管理經驗,且具有金融或監管機構最少3年以上風險管理、合規或內控工作經驗。
具有實施合規和風險管理框架的實踐經驗更佳。
了解香港金融/保險業的監管環境。
具有較強的中英文寫作能力、溝通協調能力。
堅持原則,嚴守紀律,有良好的職業操守。

Bachelor's Degree holder with 6+ years’ experience of developing and implementing complex security strategy for large enterprises
Experience in security technology such as data encryption, network attack Familiar with Anti-DDoS,WAF,Pen Test products and service  Good communication skills with track record in dealing with C-level clients,  strong ability in public speaking & presentation

Description:
The Department
Our IT Enterprise Solutions Department provides high quality end-to-end business application solutions (except betting related)
 to all divisions and departments in the Club in the portfolios of Racing, Corporate Affairs & Security, Corporate Business Planning & Marketing, Membership, Legal & Compliance, Charities & Property, and Finance & Organization Development.
This position is one of the roles inside the Functional Architect team who will focus on the equine business domain.

The Job
You will:


Collaborate with our business users and technology leaders to define and implement the enterprise technology
 roadmap and proactive technology refreshment plan to modernize the IT infrastructure in line with the defined EA roadmap


Create architectural design proposals and prepare architecture reports for management and executive teams


Recommend solutions to improve new and existing systems


Educate staff members through training and individual support


Conduct regular and ad-hoc standards review on every architecture component for different enterprise systems


Prepare technical reports and deliver presentation to all levels of management to delineate the business implications of technical initiatives and secure
 their buy-in


Drive and promote architectural standards and policies


Provide architecture advice and assistance, usually definitive, to all levels of engineers and managers

About
 you
You should have:



Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or Equivalent. Postgraduate qualification a definite plus


Around 12 years of information systems analysis/design and architecture development experience;
consultancy experience in architecture engagements a distinct advantage


Understanding of EA concepts and its implementation implications within organization depending on the maturity of the organization along the EA roadmap
Knowledgeable in the latest technologies and business processes, such as follows-


Application Development Frameworks and Tools

Integration and Messaging

Cloud computing and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS)

Data Management and Analytics

Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Internet-of-Things
 (IoT)


Experience in writing and executing RFI/RFP processes in order to correctly evaluate and recommend
 the correct technology, application, or product

Ability to influence others and be able to demonstrate peer leadership skills


Ability to apply structured thinking to analyze and reduce complex problems to its essence

Ability to define business & systems roadmaps where the requirements of one or the other is not clearly defined, identified nor
 available such as to prevent lost investments or prevent “mushrooming technologies”

Ability to lead in architecture analysis, modelling, and design ensuring alignment with business and Architecture strategy, especially
 in the areas of corporate back-office functions, such as financial accounting, budgeting, procurement, human resources, facilities management, audit, compliance, etc. This includes the ownership of the architecture artifacts, controlling the architectural
 integrity and managing critical architectural trade-offs

Consultancy experience in architecture development and information systems analysis/design.

Ability to translate core business requirements into feasible technical solution amid constraints

Ability to work effectively with people in other departments and/or outside of the enterprise


Excellent in written and verbal communication skills; ability to present technical concepts and business implications to all levels of management and secure
 their buy-in

Terms of Employment
The level of appointment will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. A contract employment will
 be offered to the successful candidate. Contract renewal will be subject to mutual agreement between the Club and the individual.
How to Apply
Please send your resume, complete with expected salary and job reference by clicking the
Apply Now button.
We are an equal opportunity employer.

Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.

Description:
Job Description
We are looking for a web programmer who can understand clients’ business and user requirements, and any technical limitations. The candidate will be responsible
 for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mockups and prototypes. The programmer will also be expected to take ownership in order to ensure a great
 user experience for our client projects, iterate upon it in accordance with internal and client reviews, and at times, user-testing. 
Responsibilities

Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
Facilitate the client’s product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.
Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
Collaborate with account servicing team, creative team and technical team, and clients.

Requirements

4+ years of relevant experience
A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability
 and accessibility concerns.  Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.
Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
Expertise in standard software such as Adobe XD (our main tool now), Sketch
Experience with latest web technologies, including JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, CSS3, Websocket, RESTFul API, etc.
Advantage to have experience on AWS / Social platform integration / Data analysis / Git and SVN / Web frameworks such as VueJS and ReactJS
A deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.
Efficient and effective, will be expected to juggle multiple tasks/projects at the same time.
Have a positive and a can-do attitude.
Languages – fluent in written and spoken English. Fluency in Mandarin and/or Cantonese is a plus.
Summary: Web Programmer / Developer,5 days work, 12 AL, dental & medial insurance,Design, UX/UI

Description:
Work Location: Hong Kong (business trip to Guang Zhou occasionally)
Project Introduction
The company’s project in Auckland, New Zealand covers an area of 160,000 square metres and can accommodate more than 2,000 residential units, including townhouses,
 low-rise apartments, and high-rise commercial complexes. The local government has invested significantly in public amenities and commercial facilities in the site’s immediate surrounding. Our aim is to set a benchmark as New Zealand’s first residential community
 built by DfMA + BIM driven by visions of Smart and Eco living, and to obtain international recognition for DfMA technology exported from China. We plan to make use of BIM throughout the project cycle, from design, procurement, manufacturing, transportation
 and assembly, as well as in strategizing the mass customization platform.
Hiring Philosophy
We are looking to recruit the sharpest minds that are keen to solve complex design and technical problems, manage R&D project and explore innovative concepts. As you
 will partner with leading DfMA and BIM companies for this project, your potential is maximised while any lack of experience will be supported by external resources.
Job description


Work with the world class BIM and DfMA consulting companies. Participate in the preparation of the Strategic Business Plans and coordination of project progress.

Conduct BIM coordination meetings

Communicate and coordinate with different parties including consultants and internal operation team in the smooth execution and delivery of projects with architectural
 designs and the usage of BIM models

Assist in the development of  BIM execution plan and BIM project workflow criteria

Maintain accurate data set in drawings, design specifications and project schedules;

Reporting to management team regarding BIM coordination progress, drawing production progress and BIM generated data

Qualifications




Master degree or above in Architecture, Electrical, Mechanical, Civil Engineering, or related disciplines;

Work experience within 3 years preferred

Hands-on BIM software / applications experience is preferred (Autodesk Revit, Navisworks, Solidworks)

Experience in Navisworks, Recap, Fuzor or other related BIM software will be an advantage;

Fluent in spoken Mandarin and written Chinese, spoken Cantonese also a plus

Fresh Graduate will also be considered

Application Deadline
30 Oct 2020
Summary: architect,construction,management trainee

Company: RSM Hong Kong 羅申美會計師事務所
Description:
RSM Hong Kong TMC department offers a comprehensive of IT Consulting and Risk solutions to our clients. Our IT risk directors are experienced
 senior managers and leaders seeking career growth, practice development, and accelerated leadership opportunities within an exciting, growing consulting practice. They are leaders who appreciate the opportunity to build teams, develop people, and serve clients
 in a dynamic fast-paced environment while simultaneously pursuing their career goals while also experiencing a rewarding work-life balance.
Our clients depend upon effective risk management, internal audit, and governance over their enterprise-wide information technology to
 achieve their business objectives. We work with a diverse group of clients across a wide variety of industries developing strong working relationships with clients built on understanding their businesses, their challenges, risks, and information technology
 (IT) requirements.
 Responsibilities:


Assist TMC Department Head to manage the entire IT Risk team in all aspects, including but not limited to practice management, people management, portfolio management and sales
 enablement. Consult with clients and demonstrate leadership on strategic plans and other business matters, help our clients to anticipate emerging risks and information technology opportunities.
Oversee the quality and timeliness of engagement teams to identify internal IT controls, assess their design and operational effectiveness, determine risk exposures and develop
 client recommendations and reports. Support external financial statement, SOX compliance, and Internal Audit/SOX engagements for application and information technology general computer controls as a leader of integrated
 external and internal audit teams. Lead consulting and audit engagements pertain to cybersecurity risk management and/or SOC attestation work.
Leverage your existing network and personal brand in the marketplace to drive growth for the TMC practice, including to identify, propose on and secure new opportunities.
Oversee a diverse book of business, maintain overall responsibility for the profitability, effective delivery and engagement risk of all client-related work within the portfolio.
Manage multiple client projects simultaneously and provide leadership on proposal opportunities and ongoing internal initiatives.


Requirements:


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in information technology, computer science, accounting or related field.

8+ years’ solid experience in the field of information technology risk management, internal audit, and/or public accounting and consulting, with a minimum of 3 years at a CPA or
 professional services firm.

Possess professional qualification(s) such as CPA, CISA, CISSP, CISM and/or CIPP.

Strong understanding of information technology controls and security experience in widely used financial applications. Having knowledge with ERP system is preferred.

Understand the relevant regulations and industry standards (e.g., SOX, AICPA SOC Reporting Standards, COSO, COBIT, FFIEC, ITIL, ISO27001, PCI, HIPAA and GLBA) and be able to apply
 these requirements to organizational internal control frameworks.

Experienced in leading engagements as well as managing projects and project financials to complete within agreed upon fees and budgets.

Experienced in managing and mentoring staff effectively while meeting stakeholder and client expectations.

Recent successful experience in cultivating new business and related market-facing activities.


Excellent command of written and oral communication skills (English & Chinese).

Confident with excellent presentation skills; strong leadership and coaching skills.


Strong relationship building and client servicing skills; capable of establishing a network of clients internally and externally.

Able to travel to meet client needs.

RSM Hong Kong offers attractive rewards package to the right candidates. Applicants please send resume, quoting the
Ref. TMC, with full career details, availability and expected salary to The Human Resources Department, RSM Hong Kong, 29/F,
 Lee Garden Two, 28 Yun Ping Road, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong or by clicking the 
Apply Now button and upload your CV.
(Data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only)
Summary: Manage the entire IT Risk team,Strong relationship building and client servicing,8+ yrs’ exp in IT risk mgmt or internal control

A proven background designing data-driven software, following observability, testing and deployment best practices.
Experience keeping track of your work using project tracking tools like GitHub and JIRA.
Participating in reviewing code, helping evaluate implementations, and providing feedback about potential improvements.

Experience working with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and/or blockchain technology a huge plus

Work with teams to improve tooling, processes, and the software they support

 requirements , review and establish policies and procedures in relation to the Bank's risk profile to comply with the regulatory or internal requirements.

Responsibilities

Support various analytical tasks and initiatives such as ICAAP, IRRBB, SDST, SA-CCR, SIMM, FRTB and other existing and upcoming regulatory requirements
Design and carry out stress testing according to regulatory or internal requirements
Review, enhance, implement and maintain the risk management methodology and procedures
Participate in various risk management related initiatives as required
Perform other jobs and ad-hoc projects as assigned by supervisor

Requirements:

Degree holder or above in Quantitative Analysis, Business Administration, Statistics or Finance disciplines
At least 3 years or above working experience in banks, preferably with experience specialized in ICAAP, IRRBB, ALM or market risk management
Self-motivated, proactive, independent with problem solving skills
Good report writing skills and analytical research capacity, and hands-on experience with in-depth knowledge in risk management
Good computer skills particularly in Excel VBA and preferably SAS

(Candidates with less experience will be considered for the position of Officer.)
Attractive remuneration package will be offered to the right candidates. Interested parties please click
"Apply Now" to submit your full resume with current and expected salary to the
Human Resources Division or by post to G.P.O. Box 139, Hong Kong.

Please visit us at www.shacombank.com.hk for more information about our Bank.

Minimum 3 years’ relevant experience in IT application development, including at least 1 year in large systems implementation project.
